title: Alfred Deakin
summary: Alfred Deakin (3 August 1856 – 7 October 1919) was an Australian politician and barrister who served as the second Prime Minister of Australia. He was a leader of the movement for Federation, which occurred in 1901. During his three terms as prime minister over the subsequent decade (1903–1904, 1905–1908, 1909–1910) he played a key role in establishing national institutions.
